docs.lead_paragraph: Wrap Up Even on a stage in the Chicago Bears stadium before an audience of union members, the Democratic candidates still vied for which one of them had the experience to be the world's leader. We'll try to keep the football metaphors to a minimum here, but whether one or the other was on offense or defense, we have to say that foreign policy issues - somewhat spurred by Senator Obama's recent Pakistan speech - and of course, the war in Iraq and trade issues, produced a few of the hottest exchanges on the stage.

docs.lead_paragraph: Note: This lesson was originally published on an older version of The Learning Network; the link to the related Times article will take you to a page on the old site.
docs.abstract: In this lesson, students learn about the history of politics surrounding health care and then create campaign advertisements for each of the 2008 presidential candidates, focusing on their proposals for health care reform.
